alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Delaware; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 9:50AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Buchanan, northwestern Jones, southeastern Delaware and northern Linn Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 949 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Paris to Palo. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Troy Mills around 955 AM CDT. Coggon around 1000 AM CDT. Alburnett and Ryan around 1005 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Central City, Paris, Waubeek, Delhi, Prairieburg, Delaware, Earlville, Oneida and Hopkinton. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 23 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
